context_bundle.summary: KMS covers cloud key management services for creating and controlling encryption keys across AWS, Azure, and GCP

onboarding.quick_start: aws kms create-key --description 'Application encryption key' --key-usage ENCRYPT_DECRYPT && aws kms create-alias --alias-name alias/my-app-key --target-key-id <key-id>
common_patterns: Key creation: 'aws kms create-key --policy file://key-policy.json --description "Application key"
Encryption: 'aws kms encrypt --key-id alias/my-key --plaintext file://data.txt --output text --query CiphertextBlob'
Decryption: 'aws kms decrypt --ciphertext-blob file://encrypted.data --output text --query Plaintext'
Rotation: 'aws kms enable-key-rotation --key-id <key-id>' for automatic key rotation
Policy management: 'aws kms put-key-policy --key-id <key-id> --policy-name default --policy file://policy.json'
known_errors: Access denied: 'aws kms list-keys' and verify IAM policies for kms:CreateKey, kms:Encrypt, kms:Decrypt
Key not found: 'aws kms describe-key --key-id <key-id>' and verify key ID or alias is correct
Invalid ciphertext: 'aws kms decrypt --ciphertext-blob file://data.b64' and ensure base64 encoding is correct
Key disabled: 'aws kms enable-key --key-id <key-id>' to re-enable disabled keys
Region mismatch: 'aws configure get region' and verify key and operations are in same AWS region
